purpose: To outline strategies for OEMs to gain transparency and influence over the semiconductor supply chain.
title: OEMs and Semiconductor Strategy
reasoning_strategy: Logical sequence of actions over short, mid, and long-term periods.

text_rules.emphasis_rule: Bold headings for each strategy phase.

tables.description: A table outlining short-term, mid-term, and long-term strategies.

cells: A. Build visibility into the semiconductor demand-supply balance over the next eight quarters across key components
B. Plan and execute rapid interventions
C. Build early warning indicators at the semiconductor parts level to prevent additional bottlenecks
Get more control over the supply chain
D. Plan IC technologies, raw materials, and manufacturing processes over a three- to five-year horizon
E. Evaluate potential structural changes in semiconductor supply terms, e.g., a premium for security of supply, extension of consignment
F. Move to sourcing approaches that provide direct control and security over supply, e.g., direction relationships with semiconductor vendors, capacity contracts
G. Identify specific semiconductors with a high potential for differentiation, e.g., in performance, integration, or supply security
H. Define new semiconductor roadmap, including new in-house development
I. Build or acquire new competencies
